title: 4 Quick and Easy Ways to Reorganize the Apps on Your Samsung

steps.title: Tap and hold an app you want to add to a folder.
steps.content: Tap and hold an app you want to add to a folder. This method will help you create folders on your home screen for grouping apps by type or purpose. The icon will bounce when you can continue.

steps.title: Drag the app onto another app.
steps.content: Drag the app onto another app. When you lift your finger, you'll see a new folder containing both apps.

steps.title: Name the folder.
steps.content: Name the folder. This could be something that describes and organizes the apps, such as “Productivity” or “Social Media.” Tap Folder name at the top, then type the name you want to see on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap + to add more apps.
steps.content: Tap + to add more apps. This makes it easy to organize multiple apps into this folder without dragging and dropping each one.

steps.title: Select apps to add and tap Done.
steps.content: Select apps to add and tap Done . The selected apps are now in the new folder. Now that your folder is created, you can drag other apps to it from anywhere on your Samsung Galaxy phone or tablet. To delete a folder, tap and hold it, select Delete folder , then tap DELETE FOLDER . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the App Drawer on your Galaxy.
steps.content: Open the App Drawer on your Galaxy. You can do this by swiping up from the bottom of the home screen or tapping the Apps icon (often 9 small squares or dots). If you have a different launcher, like Nova Launcher or Smart Launcher, you might not have the same options.

steps.title: Tap and hold an app you want to add to a folder.
steps.content: Tap and hold an app you want to add to a folder. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Select.
steps.content: Tap Select . It's the checkmark in a circle on the left side of the menu. When you tap it, circles appear at the corners of each app in the drawer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap each app you want to add to the folder.
steps.content: Tap each app you want to add to the folder. Check marks will appear in the circles of selected apps.

steps.title: Tap Create folder.
steps.content: Tap Create folder . It’s at the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type a name for the folder.
steps.content: Type a name for the folder. Tap Enter folder name to start typing.

steps.title: Tap + if you want to add more apps to the folder.
steps.content: Tap + if you want to add more apps to the folder. Otherwise, tap anywhere outside of the box to return the app drawer. Your new folder is now in the drawer. To add more apps to the folder, drag an app from the app drawer and drop it into the folder. To delete a folder, tap and hold it, select Delete folder , then tap DELETE FOLDER .

steps.title: Tap and hold an app icon on the home screen.
steps.content: Tap and hold an app icon on the home screen. You can move your apps around the home screen (and onto other home screens, if you wish) by dragging them around.

steps.title: Drag the app to another location on the home screen.
steps.content: Drag the app to another location on the home screen. When you lift your finger, the app’s icon will appear in its new place. To move the app to another screen, drag it all the way to the right or left until the next screen appears, then lift your finger.

steps.title: Open the App Drawer on your Galaxy.
steps.content: Open the App Drawer on your Galaxy. You can do this by swiping up from the bottom of the home screen or tapping the Apps icon (often 9 small squares or dots).

steps.title: Tap ⁝.
steps.content: Tap ⁝ . It’s at the top-right corner of the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap Sort.
steps.content: Tap Sort . It's the first item on the menu. If you want the apps to be ordered alphabetically by title, select Alphabetical order . This should be the default. If you prefer to have your apps this way, skip the rest of this method. Pick the option that best suits your needs and preferences.

steps.title: Select Custom order.
steps.content: Select Custom order . With this view, you can drag and drop apps to new locations for easier searching.
